page.title: 13WILDFLOWER PLANTING
page.content: On the 20th. May, 1985 a group of pupils from Thornham St. James' school took part in a wild flower seed sowing ceremony, down Thornham Old Road. The Mayor of Oldham planted the first flowers in a specially prepared patch of ground. All the children then sowed wild flower seeds over the same ground. Among the varieties sown were Poppies, Cornflower, Campion, Jack-by-the-Hedge, and Ox-Eye Daisy. When all the seeds for Thornham Old Road had been sown the children frm Thornham St. James' School were given a large packet of wild flower seeds to sow in the Nature Reserve at the School.
